rachel.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules.

katherine.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules.

kelly.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules.

cynthia.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules.

anthony.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules.

ryan.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules.

richard.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants availability and produce a combined PDDL planning domain and problem for FastDownward that finds a 30 minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 fitting all participants.

public_information: We need to schedule a single 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.
All participants must be available for the entire 30 minute meeting.
Times are given as busy intervals for each participant in 24 hour time.
There exists at least one solution that fits all participants schedules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems and FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is rachel. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->rachel->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->rachel->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that represent your availability for the meeting. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just describe your portion of the problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems and FastDownward. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownward solver. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, you keep their actions distinct and integrate their constraints to find a consistent schedule.
pddl.prompt: There are seven participants with individual PDDL availability descriptions. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities such as different names for the same time intervals. You need to integrate the PDDL responses of the participants to produce a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownward that finds a 30 minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants. Keep participant actions or predicates distinct so the final plan identifies the meeting time and verifies all participants availability. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
